metadata.title: USN-7048-2 -- Vim vulnerability
metadata.description: USN-7048-1 fixed a vulnerability in Vim. This update provides the  corresponding update for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS.  Original advisory details:   Suyue Guo discovered that Vim incorrectly handled memory when flushing the  typeahead buffer, leading to heap-buffer-overflow. An attacker could   possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-7048-2` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  vim - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-athena - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-doc - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-gnome - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-gtk - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-gui-common - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-lesstif - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-nox - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-runtime - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 vim-tiny - 2:7.4.052-1ubuntu3.1+esm19 Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
